title: Add early-2000s pink loading spinner

requirements.text: Add a subtle, early-2000s-style loading spinner that matches the existing vibrant pink theme and low-res/retro aesthetic, and show it briefly on initial app load within the 480p portal frame.

quotes: Sure! You can do a subtle loading spinner, you can make it pink or something. Sorta like the early 2000’s atat one

acceptanceCriteria: On first page load, a small pink spinner is visible for a short, fixed duration (e.g., ~400–1200ms) and then disappears automatically.
The spinner styling reads as early-2000s/retro (simple shape, slightly pixelated/low-res feel) and does not introduce a blue/purple color theme.
The spinner is visually contained within the portal frame UI (not full-screen over the entire browser), and it does not shift layout when it appears/disappears.
The spinner overlay does not block interaction longer than necessary; after it disappears, all existing UI elements behave as before.

constraints: Frontend immutable paths must not be edited: frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, and anything under frontend/src/components/ui.
Keep the app as a single-page joke experience and preserve the existing pink + retro portal aesthetic.
nonGoals: Implementing real network/request-based loading states for data fetching (the spinner may be purely cosmetic/initial-load only).
Adding or changing backend canister state, methods, or schema.
